II. Purpose of Addendum
The facility has requested an increase in the capacity at Macomb County Juvenile
Justice Center. The capacity increase is due to the expansion of the facility being
completed.
III. Methodology
8/27/2009 – Letter received from Director requesting the license modification due to
the completion of the building. A verbal request was received in June 2009.
6/9/2009 – Final inspection report received from the Department of Energy, labor &
Economic Growth, BFS with an approved rating.
8/13/2009 – Environmental Health Inspection Report received with an “A” rating.
8/20/2009 – Certificate of Occupancy from the City of Mount Clemens, Macomb
County received. Certificate # QF090081.
8/20/2009 – Fire Safety Compliance Record received with an “A” rating for the
expansion program only.
8/24/2009 – Onsite inspection.
IV. Description of Findings and Conclusions
The facility is currently approved for 120 residents in a secure residential
treatment/detention setting. The Director is requesting to increase the capacity to
140 beds due to the newly expansion and completion of the facility. There will be 80
Short term/detention beds and 60 treatment/residential beds a total of 140 beds.
The Program age range will remain the same as 10 to 17 years old. Both programs
include male and female residents.
The facility has 43, 825 square feet and includes the following physical features:
• Two secure 10 bed treatment units with individual sleeping rooms, day
observance area, and adjacent outdoor recreation area.
• Seven classrooms.
• A training room for MCJJC staff.
• Two secure outdoor recreation areas with additional green space.
• One indoor gymnasium.
• Teachers lounge.
• Four staff offices.
• Storage rooms in the basement.
The expansion building has many doors 20 or more secure doors to be exact.
Based on the Onsite inspection, and review of the program Statement and approved
Fire and Environmental inspections, it is concluded that the facility meets the Child
Caring Institution Licensing Rules to increase the total capacity to 140 beds.
2

V. Recommendation
Approval of License Modification Request to change the terms of the license to 140
residents. This will include 60 Long Term Treatment Residents and 80 Short Term
residents at this approved address of 400 N. Rose, Mt. Clemens, MI.
